alert.note: Alert for Tama (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 31 at 4:02PM CDT until March 31 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN TAMA COUNTY... At 402 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Vining, or 7 miles east of Toledo, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Vining around 405 PM CDT. Clutier around 410 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Elberon. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
